fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16117].
  {panel}

As-is we create the spaces for the space admins and choose a Theme.

But the Space Admin can change to anu-which-theme they like, which is not always a good thing.

I need a feature where I as Admin can choose which Themes Space Admins can select between.

One example is Theme Builder which we don't want anyone to play around with.
fields.summary: Ability to remove Space Admin Access to Themes

fields.description:
Exporting a large space to pdf fails with an out of memory error.  Possibly it would succeed with more memory allocated, but that's not entirely the point.

(Sub)Issues:

1. Why does it try to hold so much in memory?  Why not 'stream' the space from the database into the disk?
2. When it failed, it didn't return an error message, it just left the progress bar counting up and and up and up.  

Fixing either of those things would make this bug less painful.
fields.summary: pdf export can run out of memory and not return

fields.description:
We evaluated Confluence 2.10.3 on an Amazon EC2 instance as outlined in Adrian's blog here http://blogs.atlassian.com/developer/2009/04/setting_up_jira_and_confluence.html. We've noticed that Confluence running in this configuration can be sluggish when first loading pages. We're currently using Trac hosted on a machine in our office, which is pretty snappy. I signed up to the Confluence 3.0 hosted trial to see if the response times were any better, and it seems to be about the same as our instance running in EC2. We have a good net connection here at the office (ADSL2+), so I don't expect that's a factor.

YSlow grades Confluence an E when navigating to a space for the first time. Notice that 28 Javascript files are loaded. These really should be aggregated in to one javascript file for performance.

See the attached pictures for the YSlow and Firebug reports. 

Any suggestions on how to get Confluence running better in this configuration?
fields.summary: Confluence is extremely slow to load pages when network latency is significant

fields.description:
This should be made more readily available (not via the page information page)

Proposed solution is via a dialog.

Also, we should provide the wiki markup to link to a page via the same dialog.
fields.summary: Provide easier access to Tiny URL and Wiki Markup link via modal dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16113].
  {panel}

Would it be possible to implement a new Page permission, "Rename"?

Reason: the CAC documentation spaces are increasingly being used as the  online help for Atlassian products (e.g. JIRA is the latest to join the fold). So if a CAC page is renamed, and the relevant help-paths.properties file isn't updated, customers could click a 'Help' link and end up at a non-existent page (or receive a a suggestion for the renamed page, which is better, but still won't look very professional).

(The tech writers do watch all the CAC documentation spaces, but this isn't completely failsafe as people can easily check the "Minor Update" box.)

This use-case may perhaps be too specific to be useful to most customers; but it would help the Atlassian tech writers sleep easier :)
fields.summary: separate "Rename" permission for pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16112].
  {panel}

It would also be valuable to see if any our macros can look hotter 
easily. I am sure it would be trivial to make the note/warning/info 
macros look better, and the panel macros to. Larger icons, 
rounded corners, sexy colours, you know.

 Check out our CAC docs, they use lots of 
macros that customers will use as well.

Think: How can we make pages like these look sexy, without changing the 
content?

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Documentation+Home
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+FAQ
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Working+with+Tables
fields.summary: Make our standard macros look better by default

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16110].
  {panel}

There should be a standard method of rendering objects (Users/Pages/Attachments/Spaces etc) within confluence. Possibly a velocity macro, or an ItemRenderer class or something, but a standard way to do it (there should probably be compact/standard/detailed views too).

This would:
 * Make displaying items with plugins etc far easier, and probably make them far richer
 * Mean any extra functionality per file type (such as media previews) could be done in one place and would be applied everywhere
 * Make the UI much more consistent
fields.summary: Generic Item rendering support

fields.description:
Page ordering seems to break when I open a new node, so that I am prevented from moving a page to any page above itself in the page tree. This is a bit hard to describe in a summary statement, so here's what I was doing when it occurred:

# Opened up the JIRA docs on CAC in [page tree view|http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/listpages-dirview.action?key=JIRA]
# Navigate the tree to get to [JIRA Production Releases|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Production+Releases]
# Open up one of the child nodes in the tree, e.g. [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+3.6+Release+Notes]
# Move the child pages around under the JIRA 3.6 Release Notes, like the JIRA 3.6.1 Release Notes. (this works fine)
# Open up the parallel child node above the JIRA 3.6 Release Notes in the page tree, [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+3.7+Release+Notes]
# Try moving around the pages in the JIRA 3.7 Release Notes node. You will not be able to move the page above itself in the page tree, i.e. you cannot move the JIRA 3.7.1 Release Notes above the JIRA 3.7.2 Release Notes or "higher". The page placement highlighting will disappear and if you drop the page, it will be moved to some random page below it.

If you refresh the page and move pages around in the JIRA 3.7 Release Notes node, it will work. However, you will then be restricted from moving pages around in the JIRA 3.8 Release Nodes node as per the error described above, etc.
fields.summary: Page tree stops working correctly after page node opened
Datasource not available when page rendered via soap remote API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16105].
  {panel}

* Have a small panel in /dashboard.action that displays "recent status updates" (similar to recently updated) but just for status updates. 
* Within that panel have a "popular/trending/hot topics" feature.
 > All this does is figure out what the hot topics are in status updates within the system.
 > Links off to "related wiki pages". If a hot-topic is a page label, link off to a wiki search for pages with that label/topic.
fields.summary: Recently updated status updates & Trending/Hot topics

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16103].
  {panel}

Allow a user to update their status OR user stream via RSS. Let a user add an RSS feed to their profile. This then updates their status and/or user stream. 

Eg "Sherif blogged xyz" <<LINK>> 

This would allow the status update and user stream to become more "FriendFeed" like.

In our organisation we have 50+ of users that have their own internal corporate blogs. We also have an internal blogging platform (Wordpress MU) for users to publish blogs.

Having this feature would mean a user could "link" their blog posts with their Confluence user stream. This would open up confluence to be an aggregator of other internal collaboration tools within the enterprise. It would also mean a user can use the confluence user profile/user stream capability without necessary having to publish blogs/article within confluence, but can do it through an external system.
fields.summary: Allow support to import content for status updates & User stream  via RSS
Support for @replies in Status Updates

fields.description:
From Per:

"You can start editing office-connector documents, but it is hard to see. Need "Edit" links pervasively, e.g. in attachments tab, search results, etc. and promote it better in viewfile-macro."

Talk to Per for more information.
fields.summary: More "Edit" links for Office Connector documents.

fields.description:
Confluence exports ROME, which is great for plugins because it means they should be able to use it instead of bundling it themselves. However, jdom is not exported, so ROME does not work in plugins because they can't access the jdom stuff. Additionally, class loading conflicts mean that even if plugins include their own copy of ROME, it won't work unless the included version is different to Confluence's. Due to this, plugins such as the Activity Stream plugin need to bundle rc2 instead of the actual release.

Please either export jdom, or stop exporting ROME.
fields.summary: Please export jdom (or do not export ROME)

fields.description:
FastPageParser is deprecated and a little buggy (it can't handle script tags), we should be using HtmlPageParser instead.

Related Sitemesh bug: [SIM-198|http://jira.opensymphony.com/browse/SIM-198].
fields.summary: Avoid bugs with script tags in decorated content by using the Sitemesh HtmlPageParser instead of FastPageParser

fields.description: {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16097]. {panel} h1. Warning Fixing this bug will cause existing themes to break. page-breadcrumbs.vm currently looks like this: {code} #parse ( "/breadcrumbs.vm" ) #if ($helper.spaceKey) #contentTag("spacename", $helper.spaceName) #contentTag("spacekey", $helper.spaceKey) #end #if ($helper.page.id) $helper.page.id $helper.page.title $helper.numberOfAttachments #end #if (($page.type == "blogpost") && $postingDay) $postingDay #end {code} It a little silly to have all this sitemesh stuff in this file and it makes it really hard to find as well. We should move this stuff out into its own velocity template.
fields.summary: Sitemesh content tags are defined in page-breadcrumbs.vm

This is because of the SimpleDisplayServlet, where the plus is erroneously decoded into a space.

Proposed fix is to not urlDecode httpServletRequest.getPathInfo() (line 49 in SimpleDisplayServlet)
fields.summary: User with plus in username cannot do pretty much anything with a personal space

fields.description:
I ran the new Page Speed performance tool from Google on my local Confluence 3 evaluation site and it found several high priority issues that are affecting page performance. See the attached image for the overview. 

Among the issues found:
- 44 resources should be gzipped
- 27 JS files should be combined
- 400k of the Javascript files needs to be minimized
- incorrect CSS/JS position is resulting in unnecessary serial rendering issues
- numerous inefficient CSS selectors are slowing rendering time

I'd like to make a case for an upgrade to Confluence 3 from our major Confluence 2 installation at my company, and would prefer to demonstrate as much performance gain as possible in Confluence 3. If you fix these issues you should see significant page performance improvements.
fields.summary: Optimize Confluence page performance by addressing JavaScript / CSS / gzip issues

fields.description:
Some of the access keys and in-editor shortcuts clash with browser keyboard shortcuts which are useful in the wiki editor. Examples are Mac Emacs-style keyboard shortcuts which jump to the end and start of line (Ctrl-A and Ctrl-E), and delete words (Ctrl-K).

This issue does not really apply in the rich text editor, because the browser doesn't provide the same shortcuts there.

As originally reported:

bq. We just upgraded to version 2.10.3 and now my native Mac keyboard bindings are being overridden by keyboard shortcuts that I don't want. This drastically interferes with my ability to use the product.

This problem also exists in JIRA, covered by this issue: JRA-12378

It is possible to work around this issue with a GreaseMonkey script that removes the accesskey attributes and removes keydown handlers on the document, but that workaround is tricky to get working and likely to break across upgrades of Confluence.
fields.summary: Application keyboard shortcuts override browser text editing shortcuts in wiki editor (e.g. Ctrl-K in Safari/Mac)

fields.description: Currently, daily report just includes updates on global spaces only. Updates on personal spaces are not included
fields.summary: Add ability to include personal space updates in daily report

fields.description: Confluence does not show the RTE tab on Safari 4.
fields.summary: Support RTE in Safari 4

fields.description:
The welcome message macro cannot be added through the macro browser. It can be edited although it accepts no parameters, so this function really only acts as a preview.

Hence, the ability to add this macro to a page via the macro browser is definitely worthwhile.

Please be aware that this macro does work - [this help page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Editing+the+Site+Welcome+Message] in the DOC space indicates how you can add/edit this message - Confluence Admins only.
fields.summary: The welcome message macro cannot be added through the macro browser - please add it.
Move JavaScript out of Velocity

fields.description:
From Per:

"When closing a tab or window while in edit-mode, a Javascript Window should ask me if I am sure.  While the draft is for pages, many people won't even know how that works, and comments will be lost. I reckon that in 90% of the time, users don't want to cancel an editing session, and closing the tab is an accident. Even navigating to a different page when in edit mode is most likely a mistake. Happens to me frequently."

If a user is in Edit mode and they close this tab or window, ask them "You are currently editing [Page Name / News Item]. Are you sure you want to leave?"

If a user is in Edit mode and they navigate to a different page, ask them "You are currently editing [Page Name / News Item]. Are you sure you want to go somewhere else?"
fields.summary: When editing, prompt the user for confirmation if they close the tab or window or navigate to a different page.

fields.description: Tasklist macro is missing two parameters from the macro browser -> 'width' and 'enableLocking'. These should be: * *width* *Label* => Width of List *Desc* => Specified either in pixels (''px'') or as a ''%'' of page width. Examples: 200px or 10% * *enableLocking* *Label* => Enable Locking *Desc* => Locks individual tasks so that they cannot be changed. Also, while you're at it, my wording updates for the other areas of this macro are still not appearing on the interface. Hence, please update them as follows: *confluence.extra.dynamictasklist2.tasklist.desc=Displays a modifiable and interactive task list.* (Current description is too long and doesn't fit the interface in 'macro listing' mode) *confluence.extra.dynamictasklist2.tasklist.body.label=Tasklist Contents* (NOTE THE CAPITAL 'C' - TITLE CASE FOR LABELS) *confluence.extra.dynamictasklist2.tasklist.body.desc=Add or edit existing task contents directly using Wiki Markup. Each line becomes a new task.* (Additional sentence at end!) *confluence.extra.dynamictasklist2.tasklist.param..desc=If not specified, the default title is ''Task List''.* (Completely reworded) If these are already checked in, it might be that this macro's plugin is not using these properties.
fields.summary: Tasklist macro is missing two parameters from the macro browser -> 'width' and 'enableLocking' (and other properties use old / incorrect wording).

fields.description:
If a page which has inherited restrictions is moved away from it's parent, it retains the inherited restrictions but no longer reports that it has these restrictions.

- Create a page
- Setup Viewing Restrictions on this page (e.g. restrict to viewing for a single user)
- Create a new page under the original page. This will inherit the restrictions which can be confirmed by choosing to edit the page and examine it's restrictions. 
{quote}
Inherited view restrictions apply to this page.

Inherited view restrictions are set on pages higher up in the hierarchy. A user must be included in at least one user or group on each page in order to view this page.
{quote}
- Choose to edit the page and move it's Location to another area with no restrictions
- Once again choose to edit the page and examine it's restrictions. None will be reported. 
- Confirm that the inherited restrictions still apply by trying to access the page with someone who is restricted from viewing the original page.

The page will keep it's inherited restrictions although it is no longer in the original hierarchy. Depending upon your viewpoint this could be problem in itself (this is more a matter of opinion) but the core bug is that the page will not show it's inherited restrictions. Instead it will show that no restrictions are present, which is incorrect. To remove these 'hidden' restrictions you must change the same type of restriction (view or edit) and save the page (so to remove all restrictions two operations are needed).
fields.summary: Inherited restrictions not correctly reported if a page is moved

fields.description:
I declared in atlassian-plugin.xml the following snippet:

	<velocity-context-item key="mykey" name="Meta data holder" context-key="myctxkey" class="com.host.myclass" />

Overrided the display action using conveyor library (in conveyor-config.xml)

	<action-override name="viewpage" class="com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.ViewPageAction" inherit="true">
            <result name="input" type="velocity">templates/viewpage.vm</result>
        </action-override>

And then in the overrided vm (templates/viewpage.vm), I called a method of com.host.myclass:

$myctxkey.myMethod($page)

RESULT:

It prints "$myctxkey.myMethod($page)"  on the page.

After a server restart, It prints the correct result of the method call.
fields.summary: Server restart required to make <velocity-context-item> effective

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16032].
  {panel}

There is no way to disable the "Network" feature in Confluence 3.0. Some customers are concerned about the privacy implications of easily being able to see what changes people have recently done on the wiki.

There is also no way to disable the "Follow" feature in Confluence 3.0. Some customers are concerned about potential difficulties with employees following or not following each other.

Allowing customers to disable these features when deemed unnecessary or harmful would be a great advantage.

Note that the Status feature in Confluence 3.0 can be disabled, as it's probably not useful on public web sites.
fields.summary: Allow disabling of social features "Network" and "Follow" in Confluence 3.0

fields.description:
For greater multi-national environments it would be great to have a possibility to set certain profile attributes according to LDAP OUs or other criteria, like the language (this is my main requirement). 
We plan to run Confluence internationally and are now forced to start with english for all, instead of setting the language at runtime/log/user creation.

Ideally the language would be set as "recommendation" on the first login into confluence. The user then can change the language, if he wants to, and this should stick to the specified user.

usually LDAP directories are sorted according to geographic locations, hence this would be the ideal way to set the language. In addition, if no OU is specified, the default language needs to be used.
fields.summary: User Language Settings

fields.description:
Blog posts in global space preserve way too much space for the navigation on the right side when viewed in Safari (see screen shot).  This problem does not occur with Firefox or with normal pages.

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a blog post in a normal space (and NOT a personal space).  For demonstration purposes, it's easiest to see the problem if you include a right-aligned image, but really, any content will do (lorem ipsum, etc.)
# View the blog post in Safari
# If it's not already apparent, try resizing the window and observe the extra whitespace between the calendar and the body content.

fields.description:
You can create a space with HTML in the name. In most places this space name is correctly encoded however in the tree component given when you chose to move a page the destination space is name is not encoded properly.

To reproduce.
1) Create a space called <script>alert("Howdy");</script>
2) Create a page in another space
3) Move this new page, chosing the previously created space as the destination
4) You'll get a friendly 'Howdy' alert.

Because permissions can be set such that any user has space create permission this is a slightly greater problem than it might originally sound.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16018].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

Discovered during user sessions... "The Add Table dialog is hard and slow for me to use."

- When entering letters into the row and column fields and clicking "OK", blank space is inserted into the editor. An error message would be more useful.
- Some users would find it faster and easier if they could select a number rather than type it in.
- "First Row is Heading" label is grammatically incorrect and too long.

h3. Solution

Using the new lightbox style (e.g. macro browser), implement something like this:

!insert_table.png|thumbnail!

This will align the dialog with the current direction and make it less confusing for the confused users.

If someone wants to do something _FANTASTIC_ for _FUN_, Microsoft Word 2004 has a pretty good implementation for inserting dialogs. But it's probably a time consuming implementation and one not worth the time (which is why I haven't proposed it as the primary solution).
fields.summary: Improve "Insert Table" dialog

fields.description:
I had a user report this problem to me that I was not able to reproduce on my machine (IE7) , however, was able to reproduce on another (IE6).  *I have verified Space and Page security is not at fault.*

Scenario:

# The user is not logged into confluence and has no open browser sessions.
# A word document was created containing links to several pages.  The links are in different formats, for example:
#- http://server/kb/display/SPACEKEY/Page+Name
#- http://server/kb/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=55709465
#- http://server/kb/x/HA9SAw
# The first attempts to access Link 1 worked
# Subsequent attempts (not closing browser, not relaunching word doc) to each of the above page link types result in the same kind of page denied error:
{noformat}
You do not have permission to access /display/SpaceKey/Page+Name. To access this page, please log in as a user with sufficient permissions.

You do not have permission to access /pages/viewpage.action?pageId=55709468. To access this page, please log in as a user with sufficient permissions.

You do not have permission to access /pages/viewpage.action?pageId=55709468. To access this page, please log in as a user with sufficient permissions.
{noformat}

We did further tests, for the first page we are able to launch, I got the tinylink for it, updated the word doc, and launched from the tinylink to the same page.  What happens now is that the URL in the browser morphs into a fullblown '/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=55709468' rather than the  /display/SpaceKey/Page+Name, but still, is denied.

In summary, named links, or tinylinks pasted into IE6 work, linked links or tinylinks don't.
fields.summary: IE6 gets permission denied for links saved in a document

fields.description:
When trying to upgrade QA-EAC recently, the upgrade failed with the message -
{noformat}
2009-06-02 00:23:01,940 FATAL [main] [atlassian.confluence.upgrade.UpgradeLauncherServletContextListener] contextInitialized Upgrade failed, application will not start: Cannot proceed with upgrade. Cluster upgrade lock ac
quired but could not successfully tag build number in the CONFVERSION table. This may because you are trying to rerun an upgrade that has failed or there are communication problems between one or more nodes in your cluste
r. Please zip up your logs and attach onto a support ticket at http://support.atlassian.com.
com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.UpgradeException: Cannot proceed with upgrade. Cluster upgrade lock acquired but could not successfully tag build number in the CONFVERSION table. This may because you are trying to rerun 
an upgrade that has failed or there are communication problems between one or more nodes in your cluster. Please zip up your logs and attach onto a support ticket at http://support.atlassian.com.
        at com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.impl.DefaultUpgradeManager.permitDatabaseUpgrades(DefaultUpgradeManager.java:134)
{noformat}

The problem is that the CONFVERSION entry for the current build (1624 in this case) already has the pre_upgrade_version entry indicating it has been upgraded.

This will probably happen if the server is stopped or throws an exception during the upgrade. The individual upgrade tasks are wrapped in a transaction and the VersionHistoryDao is also wrapped (responsible for adding the tag). However, the DefaultUpgradeManager is not wrapped in a transaction so when it catches any exceptions during upgrade the changes it has made (using the VersionDataDao) will not be rolledback.

That's my theory anyway.
fields.summary: Exception during upgrade can leave version tagged as upgraded in confversion
